Name: Makassar Strait
Ordered: as a Type S4-S2-BB3 hull, MCE hull 1128[1]
Fate: Grounded and used as a target, April 1961
Displacement:
8,188 long tons (8,319 t) (standard)
10,902 long tons (11,077 t) (full load)
Beam:
65 ft 2 in (19.86 m)
108 ft (33 m) (extreme width)
Propulsion:
2 × Skinner Unaflow reciprocating steam engines
2 × screws
Complement:
Total: 910 – 916 officers and men

Embarked Squadron: 50 – 56
Ship's Crew: 860
Armament:
As designed:
1 × 5 in (127 mm)/38 cal dual-purpose gun
8 × 40 mm (1.57 in) Bofors anti-aircraft guns
12 × 20 mm (0.79 in) Oerlikon anti-aircraft cannons
Varied, ultimate armament:
1 × 5"/38 cal gun
8 × twin 40 mm Bofors anti-aircraft guns
30 × Oerlikon anti-aircraft cannons
Part of:
United States Pacific Fleet (1944–1946)
Pacific Reserve Fleet (1946–1958)
Operations:
